What are some tools and features that have been developed or are being developed to support the Verus ecosystem and its users?

The Verus ecosystem has seen the development of various tools and features that aim to support its users and enhance their experience. Two examples of these tools are VerusBox and VaultAlert.

**VerusBox:**
VerusBox is a mobile application developed by community builders that allows users to access a range of useful features and information on the go. With VerusBox, users can view the blockchain and network status, including hashrate and network distribution. They can also view market cap and coin price, and even use the app as a block explorer. This handy tool is designed to be a one-stop-shop for Verus enthusiasts, providing them with the information they need to stay up-to-date with the network.

**VaultAlert:**
VaultAlert is a web-based tool that allows users to check the status of their Vault anywhere in the world. For those who are not familiar, Vault is a feature that allows users to lock their funds in a VerusID, preventing them from being spent while still allowing staking. With VaultAlert, users can simply visit the website and search for their VerusID to access information about their Vault, including the status of the lock, the type of lock, and unlock block height and date estimates. This tool provides users with an added layer of convenience and control over their Vault.

These are just a few examples of the tools and features that are being developed to support the Verus ecosystem and its users. As the ecosystem continues to grow and evolve, we can expect to see even more innovative solutions emerge.
